LibraryTitle: K110  Solar Photovoltaic Power Plant Documents for Approval
Description: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification
FullTitleText: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification
Status: Q1 - Q1 : Quality is below Standard - Revise and Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifies requirements for medium voltage (MV) distribution transformers.  
- Details technical parameters such as voltage ratings, power capacity, and efficiency.  
- Outlines installation guidelines and operational considerations.  
- Includes compliance standards and testing protocols.  
- Intended for use in the Reko Diq Mining Project's electrical infrastructure.

Description: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
FullTitleText: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
Status: B1 - B1 : Data Complete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details installation principles for earthing, lightning protection, and equipotential bonding across the plant.  
- Specifies design guidelines, including environmental conditions and standards compliance.  
- Outlines classifications of lightning protection zones and boundary management measures.  
- Discusses earth resistivity measurement methods and lightning risk assessment protocols.  
- Addresses galvanic corrosion prevention through compatible metal selection in earthing systems.

- Document is subject to RDMC approval before use.

FolderPath: https://ppetechcoza.sharepoint.com/sites/SHERQ/Safety/Phase 1 - H&S Governance/1) Phase 1 - H&S Governance/9) General_Documentation/9.3) Comisioning Safety Procedures/References_Standards
Description:
The rating structure for all high-voltage circuit breakers, which include all voltage ratings above 1000 V ac and comprise both indoor and outdoor types, is covered in this standard. Preferred ratings are also provided. Typical circuit breakers covered by these standards have maximum voltage ratings ranging from 4.76 kV through 800 kV, and continuous current ratings of
600 A, 1200 A, 2000 A, 3000 A, and 4000 A associated with the various maximum voltage ratings. The rating structure establishes the basis for all assigned ratings, including continuous current, insulation capability (formerly dielectric withstand voltages), short-circuit current, transient recovery voltage, and capacitor switching, plus associated capabilities such as mechanical
endurance, load current, and out-of-phase switching. Generator circuit breakers are covered by IEC/IEEE Std 62271-37-013.
SummaryText:
The rating structure for all high-voltage circuit breakers, which include all voltage ratings above 1000 V ac and comprise both indoor and outdoor types, is covered in this standard. Preferred ratings are also provided. Typical circuit breakers covered by these standards have maximum voltage ratings ranging from 4.76 kV through 800 kV, and continuous current ratings of
600 A, 1200 A, 2000 A, 3000 A, and 4000 A associated with the various maximum voltage ratings. The rating structure establishes the basis for all assigned ratings, including continuous current, insulation capability (formerly dielectric withstand voltages), short-circuit current, transient recovery voltage, and capacitor switching, plus associated capabilities such as mechanical
endurance, load current, and out-of-phase switching. Generator circuit breakers are covered by IEC/IEEE Std 62271-37-013.

Description: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
FullTitleText: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details requirements for earthing, lightning protection, and equipotential bonding.  
- Applicable to electrical installations within the Reko Diq Mining Project.  
- Specifies design parameters for grounding systems to ensure safety and compliance.  
- Includes guidelines for installation and maintenance of protection systems.  
- Aims to mitigate risks associated with electrical faults and lightning strikes.

- Issued for use as of May 21, 2025.

- Includes key design parameters and specifications for instrumentation.  
- Revision 2 includes updates to sections 4.1.2, 4.1.4, 4.1.5, 4.4.1, and 5.5.6.2.  
- Issued for use as of May 21, 2025.

Description: Primary MV Switchgear Technical Specification
FullTitleText: Primary MV Switchgear Technical Specification
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Primary MV Switchgear Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specification for Primary MV Air Insulated Switchgear (AIS) for 11 kV and 6.6 kV applications.  
- Designed for compact substations with integrated arc protection and venting.  
- Rated for continuous operation under voltage variations of ±10% and frequency variations of ±2%.  
- Includes requirements for environmental conditions: -8 to +50 °C, 30-95% humidity.  
- Standardization on ABB equipment for reliability and maintainability.  
- Compliance with IEC standards and local regulations required for all components.

Description: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification
FullTitleText: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification
Status: B1 - B1 : Data Complete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: MV Distribution Transformers - Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifies design, manufacture, testing, and installation of dry-type MV distribution transformers up to 33kV.  
- Transformers are to be used in electrical power distribution for mining and processing plants.  
- Environmental requirements include operation in temperatures from -10°C to +50°C and high humidity.  
- Key design features include three-phase, air-cooled, fully encapsulated with VPI cast resin, and aluminum windings.  
- Compliance with IEC standards for losses, insulation, and quality management is mandatory.  
- Routine acceptance tests and type test certificates are required to ensure performance and safety.

Description: Integrated Power Back-up Systems - Technical Specification
FullTitleText: Integrated Power Back-up Systems - Technical Specification
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Integrated Power Back-up Systems - Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Defines requirements for design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of industrial power backup systems for mining environments.  
- Systems must provide clean, regulated power to critical loads during power interruptions.  
- Key components include rectifier/charger, inverter, and battery systems, designed for harsh conditions with modular configurations.  
- Must comply with IEC, IEEE, and ANSI standards, with specific electrical characteristics such as voltage regulation and harmonic distortion limits.  
- Features include automatic and maintenance bypass switches, comprehensive monitoring interfaces, and integration capabilities with SCADA/DCS systems.

Description: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
FullTitleText: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details installation principles for earthing, lightning protection, and equipotential bonding in mining and processing plants.  
- Specifies design guidelines, including environmental conditions (temperature, humidity, altitude).  
- Outlines classification of lightning protection zones (LPZ) and boundary management measures.  
- Includes requirements for earth resistivity measurements and lightning risk assessments.  
- Addresses galvanic corrosion and compatibility of materials in earthing systems.  
- Lists applicable IEC standards and Pakistan regulations relevant to electrical installations.

Description: Electrical Distribution Criticality Classification Specifications
FullTitleText: Electrical Distribution Criticality Classification Specifications
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Electrical Distribution Criticality Classification Specifications  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Defines electrical distribution system criticality classifications for Reko Diq mining project.  
- Focuses on medium voltage (33 kV) and low voltage (690 V) supply configurations.  
- Introduces classification codes for risk assessment: 1 (low), 2 (high), X (very high) for MV; A, B, X1, X2 for LV.  
- Outlines design guidelines for reserve and backup supply options, including diesel generator integration.  
- Emphasizes the need for collaboration with process design engineers for risk assessment and configuration selection.

Description: Prefabricated Switch Rooms (E-Houses) Technical Specification
FullTitleText: Prefabricated Switch Rooms (E-Houses) Technical Specification
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Prefabricated Switch Rooms (E-Houses) Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifies design, manufacture, inspection, testing, and delivery of prefabricated switch rooms (E-Houses).  
- E-Houses to comply with IEC 62271-202:2022 for voltages ≥1000V and ≤52,000V.  
- Environmental design parameters include temperature range (-10 to +50°C), humidity (30-95%), and seismic loads.  
- Requires factory acceptance tests and quality assurance protocols for all equipment and materials.  
- Structural design must accommodate vertical and horizontal loads, with specified ingress protection (IP56) for all components.

Description: Low Voltage Power Cables Technical Specification
FullTitleText: Low Voltage Power Cables Technical Specification
Status: B2 - B2 : Data Incomplete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Low Voltage Power Cables Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifies design, supply, installation, testing, and storage of low voltage power cables for Reko Diq mining project.  
- Covers cables rated below 1000V AC, focusing on 690V and 400V distribution systems.  
- Details environmental requirements: -10 to +50 °C temperature range, 30-95% humidity, and shock resistance.  
- Outlines cable types, construction, and installation guidelines, emphasizing the use of aluminum ECC armored cables.  
- Includes standards compliance (IEC) and safety measures for cable joints, terminations, and storage practices.

Description: MV Distribution Transformers Technical Specification
FullTitleText: MV Distribution Transformers Technical Specification
Status: B2 - B2 : Data Incomplete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: MV Distribution Transformers Technical Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifies design, manufacture, testing, and installation of dry-type MV distribution transformers up to 33kV.  
- Transformers designed for harsh desert conditions with operational limits of -10°C to +50°C and humidity of 30-95%.  
- Requires compliance with IEC standards and local regulations, including quality management per ISO 9001.  
- Emphasizes total cost of ownership, including maintenance and operational efficiency.  
- Details on materials, construction, and environmental considerations for durability and safety.

Description: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
FullTitleText: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification
Status: B1 - B1 : Data Complete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Earthing and Lightning Protection Specification  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details installation principles for earthing, lightning protection, and equipotential bonding in mining facilities.  
- Specifies environmental requirements: temp range -10 to +50 °C, humidity 30-95%, and shock resistance 147 m/s².  
- Outlines classifications for lightning protection zones (LPZ) and boundary management measures.  
- Includes guidelines for earth resistivity testing and galvanic corrosion prevention.  
- References multiple IEC standards for compliance in design and installation practices.

Description: Village Generators Local Control Panel Cable Schedule
FullTitleText: Village Generators Local Control Panel Cable Schedule
Status: Q1 - Q1 : Quality is below Standard - Revise and Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Village Generators Local Control Panel Cable Schedule  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Drawing  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details cable specifications for local control panels of village generators.  
- Includes cable tags, types, and service descriptions.  
- Specifies core size (24 pairs, 1.5 mm) and lengths (120 m).  
- Nominal voltage rated at 600/1000V.  
- Lists gland types and quantities for installation.  
- Part of the Reko Diq Mining Project documentation.

Description: Village Generator Farm Electrical Equipment Scope
FullTitleText: Village Generator Farm Electrical Equipment Scope
SummaryText:
DockName: Village Generator Farm Electrical Equipment Scope  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Details the installation and commissioning of 12 x 2250 kVA generators for a village accommodation and treatment plants.  
- Includes specifications for bulk fuel tanks with automatic refilling systems and associated control systems.  
- Outlines cable trenching requirements for MV and LV cables, including jointing and termination standards.  
- Describes area lighting requirements with a focus on solar-powered fixtures and illumination levels.  
- Specifies site-specific conditions impacting equipment design due to environmental factors.

Description: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Contains electrical and mechanical calculations for 33 kV overhead powerlines.  
- Details conductor type, insulator quantity, and equipment for tension and suspension.  
- Electrical calculations for two circuits from Plant Main SS to Mining SS with tie-in points.  
- Utilizes ACSR 330/43 conductors; voltage drops calculated at 1.91% and 1.39%, compliant with RDMC standards.  
- Includes parameters such as length, apparent power, power factor, and resistance values.

Description: 11 kV Overhead Line Calculation for Mining
FullTitleText: 11 kV Overhead Line Calculation for Mining
Status: B1 - B1 : Data Complete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: 11 kV Overhead Line Calculation for Mining  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Contains electrical and mechanical calculations for 11 kV overhead line (OHL).  
- Evaluates conductor type, quantity of insulators, and line tonnage.  
- Total apparent power calculated at 7 MVA for two feeders.  
- Voltage drop percentages are 4.91% and 3.64%, compliant with RDMC requirements (<5%).  
- Utilizes ACSR 185/24 aluminum-steel conductors, one per phase.

Description: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Specifications
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Specifications
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Specifications  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Specifications for metal tower structures for 33 kV overhead powerlines.  
- Metal towers to be fabricated from high-strength low-alloy structural steel (Q355B).  
- Bolts and nuts must comply with ISO standards; locking mechanisms specified.  
- Welding processes and quality control to adhere to multiple ISO standards.  
- Corrosion protection through hot galvanization with specific zinc consumption requirements.  
- Test assembly of steel structures required at the plant before installation.

Status: Q1 - Q1 : Quality is below Standard - Revise and Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: PPE Formal App Review Procedure - General  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Defines the standardized process for reviewing vendor documents and drawings.  
- Applies to engineers, reviewers, document controllers, and engineering managers.  
- Outlines roles and responsibilities for document upload, review assignment, and feedback.  
- Utilizes SharePoint for document management and review workflow.  
- Ensures consistency, traceability, and compliance throughout the review lifecycle.

Description: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Installation Instructions
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Installation Instructions
Status: Q1 - Q1 : Quality is below Standard - Revise and Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Installation Instructions  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Provides installation instructions for 33 kV overhead powerline metal tower foundations.  
- Requires corrosion protection for foundation surfaces before installation.  
- Specifies a granular material bed of 100 mm thickness under foundations.  
- Backfilling must use local soil, compacted to a density of at least 1.7 t/m³.  
- Installation must comply with IEC 60364 and EN 1997 standards.

- Provides a comprehensive framework for compliance with international standards and local regulations.

SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Installation Index  
Discipline: Civil  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Document outlines specifications for medium voltage (33 kV) overhead powerlines.  
- Includes bills of tower and foundation installation with detailed tables for various components.  
- Specifies types of supports, foundations, and fastening elements based on civil calculations.  
- Contains installation drawings and quantities for different tower types.  
- Final arrangements pending receipt of geological survey report.

Description: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage 33 kV Overhead Powerlines Calculation  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Contains electrical and mechanical calculations for 33 kV overhead powerlines.  
- Details conductor types, quantities of insulators, and equipment specifications.  
- Includes calculations for two circuits connecting Plant Main SS to Mining SS.  
- Voltage drops calculated at 1.91% and 1.39%, compliant with RDMC requirements (<5%).  
- Utilizes ACSR 330/43 conductors, with one conductor per phase as per design specifications.

Description: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Equipment List
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Equipment List
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage Overhead Powerlines Equipment List  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Datasheet  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Equipment list for medium voltage (33 kV) overhead powerlines.  
- Details insulator sets and fasteners required for two towers.  
- Specifies quantities needed for each type of insulator and fastener.  
- Includes references to associated drawings for installation.  
- Prepared for the 220kV & 33kV Overhead Lines project.

Topic: Technical

- Final arrangements pending geological survey report.

- Utilizes ACSR 185/24 aluminum steel conductor as per detailed design.

Description: Medium Voltage 33 kV OHL Calculation Report
FullTitleText: Medium Voltage 33 kV OHL Calculation Report
Status: A1 - A1 : Data Complete - No Comments - Do Not Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Medium Voltage 33 kV OHL Calculation Report  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Contains electrical and mechanical calculations for 33 kV overhead powerlines.  
- Details conductor types, insulator quantities, and line characteristics.  
- Includes calculations for two circuits connecting various switchrooms.  
- Voltage drop calculated at 1.91%, compliant with RDMC requirements (not > 5%).  
- Utilizes ACSR 330/43 conductors with one conductor per phase as per design specifications.

Description: Reko Diq Mining Project 11kV Overhead Lines Report
FullTitleText: Reko Diq Mining Project 11kV Overhead Lines Report
Status: B1 - B1 : Data Complete - With Comments - Proceed - Resubmit
SummaryText:
DockName: Reko Diq Mining Project 11kV Overhead Lines Report  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Specification  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Basic Design Report (BDR) for 11 kV overhead transmission and distribution lines.  
- Covers design philosophy, engineering assumptions, and compliance with standards.  
- Total line length of 4.18 km with two main sections: Shovel Assembly Pad and Open Pit Mine Area.  
- Utilizes standard tower designs to facilitate maintenance and logistics.  
- Emphasizes robust design for harsh desert conditions, including thermal and pollution considerations.  
- Preliminary route plans and profiles developed for engineering outputs.

SummaryText:
DockName: Mining Open Pit - Sags Table Calculation  
Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical  
Summary:  
- Calculation of sag and tension for overhead lines in a mining project.  
- Includes data for various spans and conductor temperatures.  
- Maximum wind speed considered is 45 m/sec.  
- Prohibits jointing conductors in mid-span.  
- Relevant for 220kV & 33kV overhead lines.

Discipline: Electrical  
DocumentType: Calculation  
Topic: Technical

- Provides notes on interpolation methods and maximum wind speed considerations.  
- Document is part of the Reko Diq Mining Project under contract number 6105AK137.
